sentences.sContent: The man is a piano accompanist.
Of course, the accompanist has to respond to the different expressiveness of the chords in supporting the melody.
sentences.sContent_eng: Of course, the accompanist has to respond to the different expressiveness of the chords in supporting the melody.
sentences.sCn: 当然，伴奏者必须对那些为旋律所配和弦的不同“表情”做出反应。

sentences.sContent: In the reverse case, when the soloist has fully mastered tempo, technique and musical expression, it is conceivable that an accompanist able to put in a level of only 80% might suffice.
sentences.sContent_eng: In the reverse case, when the soloist has fully mastered tempo, technique and musical expression, it is conceivable that an accompanist able to put in a level of only 80% might suffice.
sentences.sCn: 相反的情况，当独奏者已经完全掌握了速度，技巧和音乐性的表达，可以想象伴奏者能够发挥80％的水平就足够了。

remMethod.val: ac (加强) + com (共同) + pan (面包) + ist (…的人) → 共同演出以赚买面包的钱 → 伴奏者

words.tran: 陪伴，伴随；伴奏（accompany的过去分词）

trans.tranOther: someone who plays a musical instrument while another person sings or plays the main tune
